title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.8.22 | 15-02-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञानति मिरान्धस्या ज्ञानान्जनिषलाकया चक्षुरुन्मीलितं येनतस्मै श्री गुरवे नमः
नमा ओम विष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रिष्ठाय भूतले श्रीमते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्नितिनामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरवाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेश शुन्यवादी पास्चात्यदेशतारिने
जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभूनित्यानन्दा श्री अद्वैत गदाधर श्रीवासादी गौरभक्त वृन्दा
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchaiva Narottamam
Devim Sarasvatim Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 22nd verse of the 8th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
This verse contains one more prayer by Queen Kunti.
These prayers are being offered by Queen Kunti to Krishna when Krishna is just about to depart from Hastinapura to Dwaraka.
Nama Pankaja Nabhaya, Nama Pankaja Maline, Nama Pankaja Netraya, Namaste Pankajangraye
So this verse has been described by Srila Prabhupada as the vision of lotuses.
Each line has got the word Pankaja, means a lotus.
So the translation of this verse,
My respectful obeisances are unto you, O Lord.
Whose abdomen is marked with a depression like a lotus flower.
Who are always decorated with garlands of lotus flowers.
Whose glance is as cool as the lotus.
And whose feet are engraved with lotuses.
Angri means the bottom of the feet.
And whose feet are engraved with lotus flowers.
In the purport, Srila Prabhupada explains,
Here are some of the specific symbolical marks on the spiritual body of the Personality of Godhead,
which distinguishes his body from the bodies of all others.
We often hear the Supreme Lord has got transcendental spiritual,
form Satchidananda vigraha but his spiritual form is distinctly different
from the spiritual form of the other devotees in the spiritual world all the
inhabitants have spiritual form all the devotees spiritual word only the
Supreme Lord and his devotees nobody else is there everyone is devotee but
specifically there are some marks on the transcendental form or body of the Lord
which distinguish him from the spiritual bodies of all others so what are those
specific marks are being described four of them are described in this words
these marks are all special features of the body of the Lord even though there
is similarity in the form of the Lord and the living beings the spiritual form
you're talking with the spiritual form not
the material form these spiritual forms are similar but still there are
differences the Lord may appear as one of us but he is always distinct by his

descendants of the hierarchy classes they don't come up to theまだ dika
qualities or qualifications of the twice born, though they are taken birth in such a family.
All such classes of people are unfit by intelligence to understand transcendental subject matter
concerning the spiritual name, fame, attributes, forms, etc. of the supreme absolute truth.
Now, this is a very, very specific description here.
sthreeshudra dvijabandhunam trai na sruthi gochara
that sthreeshudra and dvijabandhu are unable to understand the sruthi, the Vedas.
It means that they don't have sufficient
intelligence to understand the transcendental subject matter concerning
the spiritual name, spiritual form, spiritual attributes, qualities of the supreme absolute truth, Krishna.
That is the sense in which it is said.
That is a specific point that is made.
although they are unfit to enter into spiritual affairs of the Lord,
can see him as the archavigraha.
Archavigraha means the worshipable deity form,
the transcendental form of the deity
just to distribute favors to the fallen souls.
So, this archamurthi or archavigraha or the deity form
is an incarnation of the supreme Lord in the material world
who appears in a form which we can see with ordinary eyes,
or comes down to this material world
to distribute favors to the fallen souls,
favoring these people who are unfit,
who do not take interest in spiritual subject matter,
who are in that sense unfortunate,
but even they can become fortunate
and having darshan of the Lord.
Because such fallen souls cannot see anything beyond matter,
the Lord condescends to enter into each and every one of the innumerable universes
from the lotus-like depression in the center of his transcendental abdomen.
And thus Brahma, the first living being in the universe, is born.
See, the Lord's mercy upon us is that he personally comes.
to come down to our level.
We are in a lower level.
We are in the material world.
Though he has nothing to do with this material world,
he doesn't belong to the material world.
He belongs to the spiritual world.
But even when he comes down,
he is unaffected by the material energy.
That is very, very important to understand, to note.
And he sends his pure devotees like Srila Prabhupada also,
who don't belong to this world.
They belong to the spiritual world eternally.
But they come down for the sake of delivering the fallen souls.
The Lord also comes down for delivering the fallen souls.
Therefore, the Lord is known as Pankajanabhi.
in the center of his transcendental abdomen,
That is why he is called Pankajanabha.
The Pankajanabhi Lord accepts the Archavigraha.

namely a form within a mind,

or it could be a stone form.
a particular specific form is either carved out,
or cast in the case of a metal,
or the metal form of Radha Krishna Chandra.
which describe how to make the form of the Lord.
